Title: New Linux malware combines unusual stealth with a full suite of capabilities
Description: With polymorphic encoding and a multistage infection chain, Shikitega is hard to detect.

Title: Unforgiveable C programming – keeping simple
Description: As many people never tire of explaining, the C language is obsolete, unsafe, unwelcome in polite company and generally looked down on  by thought leaders and adepts of λ calculus .  Here’s a program that exhibits the lamentably low level nature of  C as it changes the call stack on x86-64 so that it calls “one” and prints out “one returns 1” and then mysteriously prints “one does not return 1”.

Title: Ed25519 Deep Dive Addendum
Description: There's a few more things to know about Ed25519. Read inside to learn how Ed25519 actually works, how there are multiple implementations, and a misuse vulnerability many libraries are prone to.

Title: learning about zero-knowledge apps and circuits using the noname educational DSL
Description:
I've talked about noname previously, my toy side project to create a DSL to write zkapps on top of kimchi.
I've recorded a video that showcase it, and walks through the circuit output by compiling one of the example. It might not make too much sense if you don't know about kimchi or plonk. And so you might want to watch my series of videos on plonk beforehands.
